Posts.Content: May 6, 2008 02:13AM Dragonfly92127 wrote: Diana63 Wow...I felt the same way.  Compared to RADS, the anxiety I felt for chemo & surgery were nothing.  Today starts my last week and it gets no easier to lay on that table.  I think it is fear of the unknown. Will they do IMRT for your left sided treatment?  My Dr finally had to show me the computer diagrams of the treatment and radiation counts affecting the areas. It did help and all I had to do was ask. I am having 79 beams of IMRT + regular rads on the superclav.  it takes anywhere from 30 min to 45 min depending on x-ray days. Good luck to both of you!!

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2008 04:00PM - edited Apr 29, 2008 04:02PM by Dragonfly92127 Thank you for the support.  I really had a meltdown day.  I did see my rad onc and he assured me that I was getting what was needed.  He said I could quit any time but it was not in my best interest.  I just get SO overwhelmed at times. I have to keep thinking that any SE is better than cancer. He really is a caring person...in the office, before I went into treatment, he prayed with me to have strength and healing.
Posts.Title: I want to quit Dragonfly92127 twirlgirl

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 02:00AM Dragonfly92127 wrote: The rash, the burn, the 45min to an hour a day on the table for the IMRT just got to be to much. Yesterday I faxed over ahead of my apointment all of my questions and concerns.  My rad onc met and answered every questions and showed me the computer diagrams of my treatment.  You know...where all of the radiation is hitting.  It made me feel so much better. When we were done he made sure I understood and had no other questions. He did say I asked some good questions that he had never been asked and said no one ever asked to see the computer layout of the treatment plan. Do to some early confusion as to my treatment plan we never had the inital planning meeting.  No wonder I was freaked out!! Knowledge is power!!!!!
